summary: The Army Corps of Engineers takes on water infrastructure-related civil works projects like dams and locks. The Corps can award types of contracts known as "other transaction agreements" that aren't procurement contracts, cooperative agreements, or grants. In early 2024, the Corps revised its policy to allow these agreements to be used for research prototypes. In May, the Corps solicited proposals for designing a prototype for...
title: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers: Actions Taken to Develop Water Resources Research Prototypes
